input: Which of the following are matters on which the Parliament has the power to modify provisions of the Constitution by a simple majority ? P. Alternation of names, boundaries and areas of States. Q. Appointment of additional judges R. Abolition of the second chamber of a State Legislature S. Administration of Scheduled Areas Select the correct answer using the codes given below :
explanation: A number of provision in the constitution can be amended by a simple majority of the two houses of parliament outside the scope of Article 368. Some of these are: 1. Admission or establishment of new States. 2. Formation of new states and related subjects 3. Abolition or creation of legislative councils in states. 4. Second schedule- emoluments, allowances, privileges, and so on of the president, the governors,, the speakers, judges etc.
